subclassFeature.name: Path of the Cyborg
entries: Some may find the limitations of the flesh suffocating, and wish to augment their physical might by tempering their bodies with metals to become more than a mere mortal. These are ones who walk the Path of the Cyborg, forgoing their original limbs for the power of cold iron and steel.

There are many ways a Barbarian can augment themselves, be it through a (possibly) experienced doctor/technician, via magical means, or by doing it by hand. Cyborgs cannot hide their body modifications, and may naturally intimidate others.

subclassFeature.name: Overdrive
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you forgo your ability to rage for overloading your technological enhancements with power. You gain the Overdrive ability - which functions like rage except:

items: Number of rages is replaced by Overdrive charges, each turn of being in Overdrive costs one charge at the beginning of your turn. It costs one charge to enter Overdrive.
# of charges = rages + intelligence modifier (if positive).
Your rage no longer ends if you have not attacked or taken damage, however it will end if a spell such as {@spell dispel magic} or an E.M.P/technology disabling attack is used on you.

subclassFeature.name: Cybernetic Enhancements
entries: You get 2 enhancemnets, I'll add more flavor text later

entries.name: Brain SSD
entries: Grain proficiency in Intelligence saving throws, or another saving throw if you are already proficent.

entries.name: Enhanced Eyes
entries: You gain darkvision of 60ft; As an action, you may use your eyes to see magic (as if using {@spell truesight}), infrared and heat, or X-Ray through solid objects up to 1 foot wide.

entries.name: High-Pressure Grip
entries: You gain a +2 bonus on rolls to {@action grapple}.
While Overdriving: The {@condition grappled} creature takes {@dice 1d6} force damage at the start of its turn.

entries.name: Magnetic Palms
entries: You can attract small magnetic objects to your hands.
While Overdriving: You can attract up to medium sized magnetic objects into your hands.

entries.name: Reinforced Chestplate
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to AC.
While Overdriving: Advantage versus being knocked {@condition prone} or forcefully moved.

entries.name: Steel Arms
entries: Your unarmed attacks deal {@dice 1d6} damage. You can lift up to 100lbs more than you could before, and have advantage on strength checks related to lifting or moving heavy objects
While Overdriving: You can use the {@action Attack} action to throw a same-sized or smaller foe up to 15 feet away from you, dealing {@dice 2d6} force damage.

entries.name: Overclock
entries: You may continue Overdriving when you have 0 Overdrive charges remaining.
While Overclocking: You take {@dice 1d6} damage at the start of your turn and you can no longer be healed.

entries.name: Weapon Assimilation
entries: You replace one of your limbs with a one-handed weapon that you are proficient in. You always have access to this weapon and do not need to equip it. When you take the {@action Attack} action with this weapon, add {@dice 1d4} to your attack roll. You may swap this weapon with another one every level up
While Overdriving: You may make an {@action Attack} using this weapon as a bonus action, provided you have not used this weapon as an attack.

subclassFeature.name: Version 2.0
entries: Starting at 6th level, you gain access to more cybernetic upgrades.
You gain up to 2 additional cybernetic enhancements from this list or the previous list.

entries.name: Discharged Fingers
entries: You gain access to the {@spell shocking grasp} cantrip, which can be used while Overdriving.
While Overdriving: You gain access to {@spell lightning lure|tce} and {@spell thunderclap|xge}, which can only be used during Overdrive.

entries.name: Overdrive Battery
entries: You gain +3 maximum Overdrive charges and you recover 3 charges after a short rest.

subclassFeature.name: Version 3.0
entries: Starting at 10th level, you gain access to more... extreme cybernetic upgrades.
You gain up to 2 additional cybernetic enhancements from this list or any previous list.

entries.name: Advanced Exoskeleton
entries: You gain proficiency in Heavy Armor and can benefit from Fast Movement while wearing it. You can also remove/don armor as an action.

entries.name: Magnetism
entries: [requires Magnetic Palms] You can split off the metal portions of your body from each other using magnetism. You can move any portion of your body (such as a hand) up to 10 feet away from your body.

entries.name: Nanomachines
entries: As a reaction before you get attacked, you can expend one Overdrive charge to gain a +5 AC to all attacks (including the triggering attack) until the start of your next turn. You also instantly begin Overdriving if you are not already.

subclassFeature.name: Singularity
entries: Starting at 14th level, you become the ultimate combination of technology and flesh.
You gain 1 cybernetic enhancement from this list or any previous list and 1 additional enhancement from a previous list.

entries.name: Plastic Surgery
entries: You gain +1 to your Charisma score (can't go above 20) and gain proficiency in Charisma saving throws and one of the following skills: {@skill Deception}, {@skill Intimidation}, {@skill Performance}, {@skill Persuasion}.

entries.name: 30k Amp Hotwire
entries: [requires Discharged Fingers] You gain access to the {@spell lightning bolt} and {@spell thunder step|xge} spells at 3rd level at the cost of 2 Overdrive charges.
While Overdriving: You may cast these spells and can upcast to 4th level at the cost of 3 Overdrive charges.

entries.name: Supercomputer Brain
entries: You gain +4 to your Intelligence score, your maximum for this score is now 24.
